hints_html: Recall that \(\Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert\) means the length of vector x.
hints_latex:
Recall that $\Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert$ means the length of vector
\textbf{x}.
hints_raw: Recall that <math> \Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert</math> means the length of vector '''x'''.
question: A 01
sols_html:
The length of a vector, \(\Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert\) where x has components \([x_1,x_2,x_3]\) is,

\[\begin{aligned} ||\mathbf{x}||=\sqrt{x_1^2+x_2^2+x_3^2}.\end{aligned}\]

Since x=[1,-1,-1] then

\[\begin{aligned} ||\mathbf{x}||=\sqrt{1+1+1}=\sqrt{3}.\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The length of a vector, <math> \Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert</math> where '''x''' has components <math>[x_1,x_2,x_3]</math> is,

:<math>
||\mathbf{x}||=\sqrt{x_1^2+x_2^2+x_3^2}.
</math>

Since '''x'''=[1,-1,-1] then

:<math>
||\mathbf{x}||=\sqrt{1+1+1}=\sqrt{3}.
</math>
statement_html:
For questions A1-A3 below, \(\mathbf{x}\) and \(\mathbf{y}\) are the given vectors below.

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{x} = [1,-1,-1], \quad \mathbf{y} = [1,1,2],\end{aligned}\]

A1: Compute \(\Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert\).
statement_raw:
For questions <b>A1-A3</b> below, <math> \mathbf{x}</math> and <math> \mathbf{y}</math> are the given vectors below.

:<math>
\mathbf{x} = [1,-1,-1], \quad \mathbf{y} = [1,1,2],
</math>

<b>A1</b>: Compute <math> \Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert</math>.
